newsitem.title: USA: AMCOL unit expands minerals operations.
newsitem.headline: AMCOL unit expands minerals operations.

text.p: AMCOL International Corp's Volclay International subsidiary said Tuesday it is establishing new bentonite operations in Thailand, China and India.
Bentonite, a clay mineral, is used in producing foundry metalcastings, cat litter, ceramics, cosmetic products and a variety of additional industrial and consumer-oriented products.

Volclay Siam Ltd Co, a Volclay subsidiary, recently broke ground in Rayong, Thailand for construction of a bentonite processing plant. It expects the plant to start operations in the fourth quarter of 1997.
In China, it acquired an equity share in Jiaping Redhill Bentonite Co, which owns and operates bentonite mines and a processing plant.

In addition, Volclay International and Ashapura Minechem Ltd of India have greed to establish a joint venture company. The new company, Ashapura Volclay Ltd, will produce and market bentonite products worldwide.
